2.title: Marketing Management Platform – Design System
2.subtitle: Pioneering design systems in engineering-first environments
2.cardOverview: Built a greenfield design system from scratch with a remote developer 8 time zones away. The constraint forced unambiguous design—every token and component had to work for async, text-only handoffs. Result: 90% implementation accuracy and a system now scaling company-wide.

detailMetrics.label: faster design iteration through reusable components

left.heading: Project Overview
left.text: When I joined as a mid-level designer, I got an unusual opportunity: build a greenfield product with no systems culture and a remote developer 8 time zones away who didn't speak fluent English. Most designers at that level inherit systems—I built one from scratch out of necessity. The constraint forced unambiguous design: every token, component, and interaction had to work for async, text-only handoffs. The result: 90% implementation accuracy, an automated Figma-to-Git pipeline for JavaFX, a system now scaling company-wide, and a role that evolved to senior-level systems ownership.

left.heading: The Setup
left.text: As the solo product designer, I built a unified marketing platform from scratch—unifying fragmented data across 4 departments while pioneering the company's first design system. The project became the proof-of-concept for systematic design, now adopted company-wide.

left.heading: The Challenge
left.text: My frontend developer was 8 time zones ahead, didn't speak fluent English, and communicated only via Figma comments and async messages. If I couldn't hop on a call to explain a design decision, the design itself had to be unambiguous.

left.heading: The Solution
left.text: Developed a comprehensive design system with component libraries, detailed documentation, and code snippets that empowered front-end teams to work independently while maintaining design consistency.

4.title: Figma Design Distributor Plugin
4.subtitle: Design token automation for Figma Variables, Collections, and styles
4.cardOverview: Automating Design Token Extraction for Better Design-Dev Handoff

detailMetrics.label: from manual hours to automated minutes

left.heading: Project Overview
left.text: Automating Design Token Extraction for Better Design-Dev Handoff

left.heading: The Problem
left.text: Design teams manually extract and share design tokens from Figma, leading to inconsistencies, versioning issues, and time wasted on repetitive tasks. Teams needed an automated solution that respects existing GitHub workflows.

left.heading: The Solution
left.text: A Figma plugin that automatically extracts design tokens (colours, typography, spacing, variables) and pushes them to GitHub repositories or downloads locally, with comprehensive error handling and security considerations.

left.heading: Process
left.text:
Research and Planning:
- Identified core requirements from design systems workflows
- Mapped technical constraints of Figma's plugin environment
- Defined architecture supporting both GitHub and local distribution
